sentences: Aston Francis Barrett (born 22 November 1946), often called "Family Man" or "Fams" for short, is a retired Jamaican musician and Rastafarian.
section: N/A
== Biography ==
== Biography ==

sentences: Born in Kingston, Jamaica, Aston "Family Man"  Barrett was one of the Barrett brothers (the other being the younger brother on drums Carlton "Carly" Barrett) who played with Bob Marley & The Wailers, The Hippy Boys and Lee Perry's The Upsetters.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: He was the bandleader of Marley's backing band, as well as co-producer of the albums, and the man in charge of the overall song arrangements.
section: == Biography ==
== Biography == | === Mentorship ===
== Biography == | === Mentorship ===
== Biography == | === Mentorship ===

sentences: Barrett was the mentor and teacher of Robbie Shakespeare of the duo Sly & Robbie.
section: == Biography == | === Mentorship ===

== Biography == | === Equipment ===
== Biography == | === Equipment ===

sentences: Barrett played a Fender Jazz Bass, Acoustic 370 bass amplifier.
section: == Biography == | === Equipment ===
== Biography == | === Legal battle ===
== Biography == | === Legal battle ===

sentences: In 2006 Barrett filed a lawsuit against Island Records, the Wailers' label, seeking £60 million in unpaid royalties allegedly due him and his now deceased brother.
section: == Biography == | === Legal battle ===

sentences: Barrett's "Family Man" nickname came about before he had any children of his own.

sentences: Aston foresaw his role as a band leader and started to call himself "Family Man".

sentences: In 2012 he received a Lifetime Achievement award from Bass Player Magazine.
section: == Biography == | === Awards and recognition ===

sentences: In 2020 he was selected as number-one by the staff of Bass Player Magazine, in their ranking of: ”20 legendary players who shaped the sound of electric bass.
section: == Biography == | === Awards and recognition ===

sentences: "In 2021 he was honoured in the National Honours and Awards on Jamaica’s 59th Anniversary of Independence.
section: == Biography == | === Awards and recognition ===

== Quotes ==

sentences: “Perhaps no music evokes the notion of bass and bass tone like reggae and dub, and no two words are more synonymous with those plucking practices than Family Man.”Ali

sentences: That all happened before reggae, which kind of happened in about '69, you know, when reggae as we know it was invented by the Barrett brothers, I'd say.
